channel.title: Portfolio website for Xinyu Yu
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio website for Xinyu Yu

item.title: California Contributors
item.description: 2016 California Contributors plots We will now reproduce the plot that shows the top ten cities in highest amounts raised in political contributions in California during the 2016 US Presidential election. knitr::include_graphics(here::here("images", "challenge2.png"), error = FALSE) Taking on Challenge 2 First, we read the two dataframes # vroom() used to read data because we are dealing with a large dataset CA_contributors_2016 <- vroom::vroom(here::here("data","CA_contributors_2016.csv")) zips_df <- vroom::vroom(here::here("data", "zip_code_database.csv")) glimpse(CA_contributors_2016) ## Rows: 1,292,843 ## Columns: 4 ## $ cand_nm <chr> "Clinton, Hillary Rodham", "Clinton, Hillary Rodha… ## $ contb_receipt_amt <dbl> 50.

item.title: Mask Acceptance
item.description: NYT mask use Does mask use acceptance have any relation with some demographics? To answer this question, first I would like to get the data from Github source https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data #Source for data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(here::here("data", "nyt_mask_survey.csv")) nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "01… ## $ never <dbl> 0.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Beer Drinking
item.description: Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? Back in 2014, fivethiryeight.com published an article on alcohol consumption in different countries. I will use this dataset to analyse where do people drink the most beer, wine and spirits. Load data First I will load and analyse the dataset. library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) Let’s take a glimpse at it. glimpse(drinks) ## Rows: 193 ## Columns: 5 ## $ country <chr> "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", "A… ## $ beer_servings <int> 0, 89, 25, 245, 217, 102, 193, 21, 261,… ## $ spirit_servings <int> 0, 132, 0, 138, 57, 128, 25, 179, 72, 7… ## $ wine_servings <int> 0, 54, 14, 312, 45, 45, 221, 11, 212, 1… ## $ total_litres_of_pure_alcohol <dbl> 0.

item.title: Movies Analysis
item.description: What is the relationship between IMDB ratings and gross profits of movies? Analysis of movies- IMDB dataset I will first look at a subset sample of movies, taken from the Kaggle IMDB 5000 movie dataset # Save data set in variable "movies" movies <- read_csv(here::here("data", "movies.csv")) # Take a look at the data frame glimpse(movies) ## Rows: 2,961 ## Columns: 11 ## $ title <chr> "Avatar", "Titanic", "Jurassic World", "The Aven… ## $ genre <chr> "Action", "Drama", "Action", "Action", "Action",… ## $ director <chr> "James Cameron", "James Cameron", "Colin Trevorr… ## $ year <dbl> 2009, 1997, 2015, 2012, 2008, 1999, 1977, 2015, … ## $ duration <dbl> 178, 194, 124, 173, 152, 136, 125, 141, 164, 93,… ## $ gross <dbl> 760505847, 658672302, 652177271, 623279547, 5333… ## $ budget <dbl> 237000000, 200000000, 150000000, 220000000, 1850… ## $ cast_facebook_likes <dbl> 4834, 45223, 8458, 87697, 57802, 37723, 13485, 9… ## $ votes <dbl> 886204, 793059, 418214, 995415, 1676169, 534658,… ## $ reviews <dbl> 3777, 2843, 1934, 2425, 5312, 3917, 1752, 1752, … ## $ rating <dbl> 7.
